Strategies for Writing and Research

Quick and practical writing and research strategies, collaboratively designed by students, teachers, and librarians at UCLA.

For students
For instructors
About us

Where would you like to start?

Check out one of our themed collections, or see a list of all our tutorials.

Getting Started

Generating research questions, planning your project, and getting ready for research.

Finding Sources

Learn practical strategies to search for books, articles, and more.

Writing and Citing Sources

Learn how to integrate your sources into your academic writing.

Literature Reviews

Get ready to analyze the literature on your topic and identify areas for future scholarship.

Sharing your Research

A quick introduction to abstracts, elevator speeches, and opportunities to share your work.

Hey there, Bruins!

We're WI+RE (Writing Instruction + Research Education), a collaborative UCLA community focused on helping all learners succeed in their writing and research projects.

Learn more about WI+RE!

As strong believers in open educational resources, all of our code is open source, and our tips can be shared, re-used, and re-mixed.

Our content is available through a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike license.
This site is built in Jekyll, hosted on Github and themed with a modified version of Creative Theme.
Want to collaborate? Us too! Let us know your ideas!


See our code!

Keep in touch!

We'd love to hear from you.
